intro: Gymnosporia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed burr plant, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by pod-like fruits that contain hard, spiny seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Gymnosporia gracilipes is noted for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
